lead_paragraph: The president of the union representing the city’s correction officers says hearings about guards’ disciplinary cases should be closed to the public.
snippet: The president of the union representing the city’s correction officers says hearings about guards’ disciplinary cases should be closed to the public.

headline.main: A Move to End Transparency for New York’s Jails
headline.print_headline: A Move to End Transparency for the Jails

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Office of Administrative Trials and Hearings (NYC)

abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column calls attention to legal effort mounted by New York City Correction Officers’ Benevolent Assn to make proceedings at Office of Administrative Trials and Hearings involving corrections officers confidential; holds that public access to information reviewed in administrative hearings about officer misconduct, from merely embarrassing to criminal  behavior, is only way public can know what goes on behind prison doors.
